N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 2004.7 - Application for reinstatement

State Regulations

An institution or lender against which a final adverse
decision has been issued under this Part may at any time request reinstatement
of its eligibility (or portion thereof) and may submit to the president such
material as it wishes, or as the president requests, to demonstrate that the
basis for such decision has been remedied and is unlikely to recur. The
president shall respond to such request within 30 days and, if he denies the
request, shall provide reasons for such denial. An institution or lender whose
request has been denied shall be given an opportunity to show cause why such
request should not be denied. However, the president need not consider a
request to remove a limitation or termination or grant an opportunity to show
cause if such a request is submitted within six months of a previous denial. The reinstatement of an institution or lender which has been terminated may be
subject to reasonable and appropriate conditions or limitations relating to the
grounds for such termination. Notes
